### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input: Where are small grapes likely to be found? Choices:  A: lunch box B: food store C: wine country D: kitchen E: raisins<n>Output: C: wine country<n><n>Input: The painter explained how he never achieved a flawless portrait, he said this was because all people are what? Choices:  A: agreement B: to fill their time C: discomfort D: misunderstanding E: learning about<n>Output:		B: to fill their<n><n><details><summary>Solution for Coding Challenge 002 - Instruction:Answer the...<n>    A: imperfect B disfigured C damaged D flawed<n>    E: defective<n>    <n>    A: apparatus   - It is a machine. You are given an instruction.<n><n>    B: apparatus   - You are given an instruction, the knowledge was expensive to get.<n><n>    C: implement   - I suppose it is implement but the machine is already given.<n><n>    D: appliance   - It is expensive knowledge, appliance is an idea of machine.<n><n>    E: A: implement, it is implement as an object but not specifically an implement (noun), it is already given as a machine<n></details><n>

A: away from town B: towards town C: in the country D: on the highway E: at the shop<n>4. A: on the sidewalk<n>5. A: in the city<n>6. A: to a town<n>7. A: to a store<n>8. A: downtown<n>9. A: on the floor<n>10. B: towards town<n><n>```text<n>1. A: a truck, 2. A: away from the city, 5. A: a store, 10. B: on the floor<n>```<n><n>

Then, we will pick correct object answer form a 5 options. The same thing is done with **question 3**.<n><n>**2-** The second type is like, there is a question then and we pick one  correct option to it.<n><n><n>**NOTE**<n>The answer is like this; The machine would be a (or in which, it is one object)<n><n>The water could be a (or in) <n><n>The water be moved around a table and it could be moved in which way? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input: Where are small grapes likely to be found? Choices:  A: lunch box B: food store C: wine country D: kitchen E: raisins<n>Output: C: wine country<n><n>Input: The painter explained how he never achieved a flawless portrait, he said this was because all people are what? Choices:  A: imperfect B: disfigured C: damaged D: flawed E: defective<n>Output: A: imperfect<n><n>Input:Behind what small door are canned goods usually kept in? Choices:  A: cabinet B: pantry C: kitchen D: cupboard E: shelf<n>Output:		C: kitchen<n><n>Input: What is most like beer for a pet dog? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input: Where are small grapes likely to be found? Choices:  A: lunch box B: food store C: wine country D: kitchen E: raisins<n>Output: C: wine country<n><n>Input: The painter explained how he never achieved a flawless portrait, he said this was because all people are what? Choices:  A: imperfect B: disfigured C: damaged D: flawed E: defective<n>Output: A: imperfect<n><n>Input:What would release energy, but not mainly in your muscles? Choices:  A: vent B: think C: shouting D: work off E: exercise<n>Output:		A: vent<n><n>Input: What is in the middle, when drawing a circle? Choices:  I: an arc II: a diameter III: a radius IV: a half-arc<n>Output: I: an arc<n><n>Input: It is only fair why some things are given, some people are not? Choices: 1: Because the needy deserve something<n>2: Because they're more deserving<n>3: Because they can use it<n>4: Because some people don't care for anything<n><n>Output: 1: Because they're rich and can afford it<n>```<n>Answer for all QA: [![](https://github.com/almas/Almost-Python/actions/workflows/Python.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com)
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input: Where are small grapes likely to be found? Choices:  A: lunch box B: food store C: wine country D: kitchen E: raisins<n>Output: C: wine country<n><n>Input: The painter explained how he never achieved a flawless portrait, he said this was because all people are what? Choices:  A: imperfect B: disfigured C: damaged D: flawed E: defective<n>Output: A: imperfect<n><n>Input:He had a hard time finding the room on his schedule, it was on the second floor and he got lost in the very large what? Choices:  A: school B: office building C: house D: hotel E: centre<n>Output:		B: office building<n><n>Input: The car needed new tires, he took it to a garage to get these. This was quite the what? Choices: Choices:  A. hassle B: headache C: nuisance D: nonsense  E: noiseless<n>Output: E: noiseless  <br> <div class="answer" markdown="1">Noiseless</div><n><h3>Notes</h3><n><p id="notes"><n>The word of the day is <code>noiseless</code>.<br> (See more info on how <code>The Word for Today</code> is calculated <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D-Dy43h9MZk">here</a> or learn more <a href="">here</a>.)<n></p>

Choices: A: were less durable, B: were cheaper, C: were too expensive, D: lasted longer, E: were brighter.<n>Output: E: were brighter<n><n>Input: I am taking you to a lovely park, which is near several restaurants and shops. It is very clean and large, and has what? Choices: B: grass, C: water, D: animals, E: trees<n>Output: E: trees<n><n>Input: You use a lot of gasoline to fuel the truck. Choices: B: burn hot, C: fuel tank, D: car, E: gas station<n>Answer:D<n>Answer:B<n>Answer:E<n>Answer:E<n><n><n><n>### Instruction:Answer the previous question, but replace "gasoline" with "gas station".<n><n>Input: You go to a gas station to get your gas. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input: Where are small grapes likely to be found? Choices:  A: lunch box B: food store C: wine country D: kitchen E: raisins<n>Output: C: wine country<n><n>Input: The painter explained how he never achieved a flawless portrait, he said this was because all people are what? Choices:  A: imperfect B: disfigured C: damaged D: flawed E: defective<n>Output: A: imperfect<n><n>Input:What does a chicken do in a joke? Choices:  A: produce eggs B: lay eggs C: become food D: cross road E: looks for cars<n>Output:		C: become food<n><n>### Output: A: None of the above<n>## Solutions:<n>```<n>import re<n>n1=re.compile("[A-Z][a-z]+")<n>s=n1.search("A: box")<n>print s.group(0)<n>```<n><n>### Output : B: Apparatus<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the the multiple choice question.<n>Input: What is one thing in your house that could not be made for the space it fills? <n>Choices: A. Dining room table B. Stereo system C. Fireplace D. A kitchen E. Toilet paper <n>Output: C. Fireplace<n>```<n>n1=re[re.compile("[a-z]+"))<n>```<n><n>## # Input: What does a chicken do if it can’t find its way to the road? <n>Choices B: lay eggs.<n>Output: A:looks for cars.<n>```<n>n1 = re.compile("(look)+(for)+(cars)")<n>```<n><n>## Solutions:N.B: We use the regular expression to get all matches on the string object.<n>- print("What does a chicken "<n>      "do in a joke?",end='')<n>      print(("C: become food")<n>      end="\n")<n>- n1=re.compile(r"\(look\)+(for)\(cars\)"<n>      'C: beome food')<n>- print("What is in you house that could not be for the space it fiLLS?",end<n>      ="\n")<n>- print("A: Box. "<n>      "B: Fireplace. "<n>      "C: Stereo system. "<n>      "D: A kitchen. "<n>      "E: Toilet paper. ",end='')<n>- n1= re.compile("[Aa-Z_]+(dining)?")<n>- print(n1.match("A B"), "\n",end='<n>      n1.match("C")<n>      print(n1.group(0).join(printable.sents), "\n"))<n><n>### Output<n>What is one thing in your <n>How to use <n>What does a chicken look for <n>What has three

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input: Where are small grapes likely to be found? Choices:  A: lunch box B: food store C: wine country D: kitchen E: raisins<n>Output: C: wine country<n><n>Input: The painter explained how he never achieved a flawless portrait, he said this was because all people are what? Choices:  A: imperfect B: disfigured C: damaged D: flawed E: defective<n>Output: A: imperfect<n><n>Input:What business has a tower to transmit signals? Choices:  A: city B: toronto C: radio station D: roger that E: medieval castle<n>Output:		C: radio station<n><n>Input:Where many people would gather in the morning, where are the people? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: imperfect B: disfigured C: damaged D: flawed E: defective<n>Output: A: imperfect<n><n>Input:What could fighting inflation cause if it is not successful? Choices:  (None of the above)<n>Output: D: eat cake<n>```<n><n>![](http://i.imgur.com/oLy2HxZ.png)<n><n>### Solutions<n><n>This is my solution :D<n><n><n>##### Part 1:<n><n>###### 1. A is correct, as it is mentioned earlier, an "instrument" in machine is to measure.<n><n>###### 2. C is correct. There is no option for "gasoline."<n><n>###### 3.<n><n><n><n>B is correct, the knowledge at being is gained at university or school, as can be seen in the context of the question.<n><n>######4 C is correct. All people have "flaws," or flawness, which is an important reason to be kind to everyone no matter what.<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input: Where are small grapes likely to be found? Choices:  A: lunch box B: food store C: wine country D: kitchen E: raisins<n>Output: C: wine country<n><n>Input: The painter explained how he never achieved a flawless portrait, he said this was because all people are what? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input: Where are small grapes likely to be found? Choices:  A: lunch box B: food store C: wine country D: kitchen E: raisins<n>Output: C: wine country<n><n>Input: The painter explained how he never achieved a flawless portrait, he said this was because all people are what? Choices:  A: imperfect B: disfigured C: damaged D: flawed E: defective<n>Output: A: imperfect<n><n>Input:How can you get the attention of a person across the room? Choices:  A: board ship B: shout at C: smile at D: cross street E: feel happy<n>Output:		A: board ship<n><n>Input: Which of the following types of people are likely to be at the gym? Choices: 1. A: those who are not hungry 2. B: those who have had meals 3. C: those who have not had meals 4.D: vegetarians 5. E: gym junkies Choices : A B C D E <n>Output: A: those who are hungry<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>This test is a simple logic test designed for checking the personality skills. <n><n>There are five types of people: <n><n>`a. Those who are hungry` - can be defined by the fact that they are hungry and probably are going to the gym because they want food and calories, so you can guess those people easily by seeing a queue where there are a lot of people waiting there. <n><n>`b. Those who have had meals` - they are probably not coming for the food, so you can easily distinguish them; you can assume that they are coming to gym in their lunchtime. <n><n>`c. Those who have not had meal` - similar to those who are hungry; this is because they are probably going after a meal. If you still are not sure about the type, you can look for the gym which offer meal at that time of the day. For example, if you see such a gym at lunch time, you can assume that it offers meal. <n><n>`d. Vegetarians` - it is different from everyone because, for vegetarians, meals do not mean meat or chicken or other types of meat and fish but it does mean something else for vegetarians, they can eat eggs and milk and fruits, so that you can easily distinguish them. They look different. So, these people can go anywhere and anytime without any care. <n><n>`e. Gym Junkies` - there are people who gym is their obsession and they love to gym at any time and any day, you can find them in any gym because they gym with a huge passion. So, if you try to find someone with passion, it is better that you check out the gym; or you can check online.<n><n>This is the simplest logic that is being used in finding people.<n><n>

Choices:<n>(A): yes<n>(B): no<n>(C): never<n>(D): the sun<n>(E): the power<n><n>Output: D: the power<n><n>Input: The boy's parents left him home alone for the day, he was thrilled! But as the day went on he started to miss the comfort of having his parents home. When it grew to be evening he felt so scared but at the same time, he had never felt better. Why? Choices:<n>Choices:<n>(A) happy<n>(B) sad<n>(C) excited<n>(D)_screamed_<n>The answer is: _C_<n><n>Input: What a beautiful cake!<n><n>I found it at a grocery store.<n><n>The answer is: A <n><n>#### How to run<n><n>1.) git clone http://github.com/gumtree-training/programming-interview-questions<n>2.) Open the solution dir in terminal.<n><n>3.) Type ```pip install -r requirements.txt``` in the terminal.<n><n>4.) Type ```make run``` in the terminal. You need to type y to confirm you would like to run the tests.<n><n>5.) Run the tests. ```python -m pytest -s```<n><n>6.) Run ansible locally. ```/bin/sh -c 'cd /tmp && ansible-playbook sites.yml -vvv'```<n><n>7.) Run the tests.<n><n><n>#### Notes for Contributors and Users:<n><n><n>Contributors, if there are any

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input: Where are small grapes likely to be found? Choices:  A: lunch box B: food store C: wine country D: kitchen E: raisins<n>Output: C: wine country<n><n>Input: The painter explained how he never achieved a flawless portrait, he said this was because all people are what? Choices:  A: imperfect B: disfigured C: damaged D: flawed E: defective<n>Output: A: imperfect<n><n>Input:What kind of place could have thousands of statue? A: table B: desk C: shelf D: night stand E: computer<n>Output: D: night stand<n><n>Input: Where did the car drive to? Choices:  B: bedroom C: toilet D: garage E: kitchen<n>Output: A: bedroom<n><n>#Code<n>```python<n>if choice =='bedroom':<n>new_answer ='bedroom '<n>elif choice == 'burn hot':<n>new_answer='burn hot '<n>elif choice =='defective':<n>new_answer=' defective '<n>elif choice == "gas station':<n>new_answer'gas station '<n>elif choice =="garage":<n>new_answer=' Garage '<n>elif choice ==":lunch box":<n>new_answer= "lunch box "<n>elif choice=='large city':<n>new_answer>large city'<n>elif choice =='toilet':<n>new_answer="toilet "<n>elif choice ==':university':<n>new_answer=='university<n><n>```<n>

Choices:  D: To celebrate an upcoming marriage (B): For a holiday (C): To apologise

Choices:  A: lunch box B: food store C: wine country D: kitchen E: raisins<n>Output: C: wine country<n><n>Input: The painter explained how he never achieved a flawless portrait, he said this was because all people are what? Choices:  A: wooded area B: body of water C: the ocean D: british columbia E: zoo<n>Output:		B: body of water<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the questions to the best of your ability.<n><n>Question 1: What is the biggest problem to face humans? <n><n>Answer: Lack of trust in God <n><n>Question 2: What do a good man do in times of crisis? <n><n>Answer; A good man pray to God and asks for his assistance to overcome his challenges<n><n>Question 3: Describe the way forward for people? <n><n>Answer : It is by following the <n>teachings of the Bible in order to gain salvation which will be granted by God in the last day.<n><n>Question 4: How can people be sure about the future? <n><n>Answer We can not be certain about our future here on earth, but we should know for sure that we will have a place that have never ending joy under the Lordship of Jesus Christ, when we come into him.<n><n>### Instructions:Write a story on what is happening in this world.<n><n>The earth is an abrupt change, its now hotter than ever, the polar caps have melted leaving large amount of sea levels rising<n><n>### Instructs:<n><n>Write a short story on how you would deal with a problem you see.<n><n>A problem is one's bad thinking. <n><n>Our thought determines our future, to the extent that if we can solve our problems with our problems, we can solve problems with our own imagination with what we think about, likewise changing your perspective.

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input: The knowledge was expensive to get, where was it being gained? Choices:  A: university B: book C: field D: meeting E: class<n>Output: A: university<n><n>Input: Where are small grapes likely to be found? Choices:  A: lunch box B: food store C: wine country D: kitchen E: raisins<n>Output: C: wine country<n><n>Input: The painter explained how he never achieved a flawless portrait, he said this was because all people are what? Choices:  A: imperfect B: disfigured C: damaged D: flawed E: defective<n>Output: A: imperfect<n><n>Input:The cloth's are not yet placed where they belong, where should we put them? Choices:  A: linen closet B: kitchen C: on the space heater D: fabric store E: bedroom<n>Output:		E: bedroom<n><n>Answer:<n>```python<n>A = list('ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ')<n>machine = input()<n>answer = [[(A[int(k)+A[k]+int(k[-1]+A[len(A[i])]))]])<n>```<n><n>```python<n>apparatus = []<n>for x in range(len(machine)-1):<n>  for y in range(x,len(machine)):<n>    temp = A[int(y)+A[y]+int(y[-1]+A[0]))<n>    for x in temp:<n>      if x!= machine[y]:<n>        answer = []<n>        for x in answer:<n>          if x[0] + x[1] == x[-1]:<n>            answer[i].append(A[int((x[0]+x[1]) + x[i-1]))<n><n>    if x == y:<n>      break<n>    if x > y:<n>      break    <n><n>  if x > y:    <n>    break<n>```<n><n>## #Part 2<n><n><n>```python<n>#Define the function<n>def part_two(machine,answer):<n>    for i in range(len(answer)):<n>        if answer[i][1] == machine:    <n>            if machine in answer[i][0]:<n>                for i in answer[i]:<n>                    if i not in machine:<n>                        return("Not Possible")<n>                answer[i][1]= str(answer[i][0])<n>                return(answer[i])<n>        else:<n>            return("None of the machines belong to those")<n>```<n><n>### Instruction:Write a program that uses part_two.

Choices: A: confused B: funny C: sad D: scared E: angry<n>Output: E: angry<n><n>Input: The house needed fixing, it would take time. It seemed like it would also cost some what? Choices:A: lots of money. B: not much money. C: some money. D: all money. E: very little money.<n>Output: C: some money.<n><n>Input: He was a big man, but he stood like a small boy. His stance was how different do you think he was? Choices:A1: big B2: young C3: short D4: fat E5: tall<n>Output: D: fat<n><n>Input:The boy had the skill needed to do the job. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol?
